abstract.text: Overwrites the selected channels of a 32-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved buffer with the specified scalar value.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The scalar value that provides the new channel values.
The source vImage buffer that provides the original pixel values.
A pointer to the destination vImage buffer structure. You’re responsible for filling out the

fields of this structure, and for allocating a data buffer of the appropriate size. On return, the data buffer this structure points to contains the destination image data. When you no longer need the data buffer, deallocate the memory to prevent memory leaks.
A bitmask that specifies the channel or channels that the function overwrites with the scalar value. The value
The options to use when performing the operation. If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass
; otherwise, one of the error codes in

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A type for a planar, 32-bits-per-channel, floating-point pixel.
A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
The vImage function completed without error.
A flag that sets the behavior to the default.
Overwrites the selected channels of an 8-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved buffer with the specified scalar value.
Overwrites the selected channels of a 32-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved buffer with the specified scalar value.
Overwrites a floating-point 16-bit planar buffer with the specified scalar value in place.
Overwrites a signed 16-bit planar buffer with the specified scalar value in place.
Overwrites an unsigned 16-bit planar buffer with the specified scalar value in place.
Overwrites an 8-bit planar buffer with the specified scalar value in place.
Overwrites a floating-point 32-bit planar buffer with the specified scalar value in place.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
The height of the image, in pixels.
The distance, in bytes, between the start of one pixel row and the next in an image, including any unused space between them.
The width of the image, in pixels.
A type for image errors.
A type for processing options.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
An 8-bit unsigned integer value type.
